Class Planet

  • java.lang.Object
    • Planet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Planet
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Creates a Runnable Planet object that autonomously orbits around a given point at a given radius
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Zach Swanson

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int centerX
      X-coordinate of orbited point
      private int centerY
      Y-coordinate of orbited point
      private java.awt.Point loc
      Current location in space
      private int orbit
      Orbit number (for example Sun=0, Mercury=1, Venus=2, and so on)
      private static int ORBIT_SIZE
      Distance between orbits
      private double radians
      Total angular distance traveled
      private int size
      Diameter of Planet
      private double speed
      Angular velocity in radians

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Planet(int o, int width, int height, int size)
      Creates new Planet

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getSize()
      Returns diameter of this planet
      int getX()
      Returns this planet's current x-coordinate
      int getY()
      Returns this planet's current y-coordinate
      void run()
      Calls update function even 10 milliseconds until thread is terminated
      private void update()
      Adds angular velocity to current angular location, calculates the new Cartesian location, and updates location

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Planet

        public Planet(int o,
      int width,
      int height,
      int size)
        Creates new Planet
        Parameters:
        o - orbit number of this Planet
        width - width of window (divided by 2 to get orbited point)
        height - height of window (divided by 2 to get orbited point)
        size - diameter of planet

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Calls update function even 10 milliseconds until thread is terminated
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        See Also:
